Welcome to Assignment 6 - in3110’s documentation!¶

Note

This is documentation of the backend code to generate plots and present them.

webvisualization.main()¶

Main Function to start the web server

webvisualization.plot_reported_cases_per_million_html(request: starlette.requests.Request)¶

Root route for the web application. Handle requests that go to the path “/”.

Parameters

request – API reqest

Returns: Main page

webvisualization.plot_reported_cases_per_million_json(countries: Optional[str] = None, start: Optional[str] = None, end: Optional[str] = None)¶

Handles routes that direct for ‘/plot_reported_cases_per_million.json’ Function to get a custom chart.

Parameters

  • countries (list(string)) – List of countries to be included in the plot.

  • start (string, optional) – The first date to include in the returned dataframe. If specified, records earlier than this will be excluded. Default: include earliest date Example format: “2021-10-10”

  • end (string, optional) – The latest date to include in the returned data frame. If specified, records later than this will be excluded. Example format: “2021-10-10”

Returns

altair Chart of number of reported covid-19 cases over time.

webvisualization_plots.all_countries()¶

Functions to get all cuntries in dataset. Returns: list of all countries in dataset.

webvisualization_plots.get_data_from_csv(columns, countries=None, start=None, end=None)¶

Creates pandas dataframe from .csv file.

Data will be filtered based on data column name, list of countries to be plotted and time frame chosen.

Parameters

  • columns (list(string)) – a list of data columns you want to include

  • countries ((list(string), optional) – List of countries you want to include.

  • passed (If none is) –

  • highest (dataframe should be filtered for the 6 countries with the) –

  • chosen. (number of cases per million at the last current date available in the timeframe) –

  • start (string, optional) – The first date to include in the returned dataframe. If specified, records earlier than this will be excluded. Default: include earliest date Example format: “2021-10-10”

  • end (string, optional) – The latest date to include in the returned data frame. If specified, records later than this will be excluded. Example format: “2021-10-10”

Returns

returns dataframe for the timeframe, columns, and countries chosen

Return type

cases_df (dataframe)

webvisualization_plots.main()¶

Function called when run as a script

Creates a chart and display it or save it to a file

webvisualization_plots.plot_reported_cases_per_million(countries=None, start=None, end=None)¶

Plots data of reported covid-19 cases per million using altair. Calls the function get_data_from_csv to receive a dataframe used for plotting.

Parameters

  • countries ((list(string), optional) – List of countries you want to filter.

  • passed (If none is) –

  • highest (dataframe will be filtered for the 6 countries with the) –

  • chosen. (number of cases per million at the last current date available in the timeframe) –

  • start (string, optional) – a string of the start date of the table, none

  • on (of the dates will be older then this) –

  • end (string, optional) – a string of the en date of the table, none of

  • one (the dates will be newer then this) –

Returns

altair Chart of number of reported covid-19 cases over time.
